Arsene Wenger will not be leaving Arsenal until the club have a serious plan in place. 
That's the opinion of former Gunners star Martin Keown, who believes the Frenchman could remain at the helm of the club for another two years. 
Wenger's future has been the source of much speculation over the past few weeks, as frustration among a section of the club's support has continued to grow. 
But Keown does not think these fans will be getting their wish anytime soon, simply because the board will not want to make a rash decision. Martin Keown believes Arsene Wenger should have a say in who replaces him at Arsenal (Photo: Michael Regan - The FA) 
That said, Keown does believe the "end is coming" for the legendary manager, who has been in charge of the north London club for 20 years. 
Speaking on BBC Match of the Day, the former defender said: "I do feel if he was to go now without any succession plan management from the club, it would be too soon. Keown believes the Frenchman could be in charge of the club for another two years (Photo: Arsenal FC via Getty) 
"I don't think the board are ready yet, or this club is ready, for him to leave. There is a lot of thinking that needs to be done at a high level. 
"Yes, that end is coming, but maybe another contract of one year or two years, and Wenger should be made to be a part of the manager who comes in. A section of the Arsenal support would like to see Wenger leave the club (Photo: Alex Livesey) 
"Somebody in the same mould, because he has been a part of all the decisions that have been made their, the new stadium, that was Arsene Wenger's idea. 
"There may be a group of people at Arsenal who claim to have had that idea, but Arsene Wenger is clever." poll loading What should Arsene Wenger do at the end of the season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
